intro: Proustia glandulosa, commonly known as the glandular proustia, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features slender, branching stems covered in small, glandular hairs, which give it its scientific name. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with ray florets surrounding a central disc of tubular flowers. Proustia glandulosa is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to thrive in arid environments.
